Legal_Issue: Standard of review applied by RAD
Evidence_Assessment: RPD's findings on applicant's credibility and refugee claim
Decision_Outcome: RAD upheld RPD's denial of refugee status
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to establish refugee protection eligibility
Legal_Rule: RAD must apply 'palpable and overriding error' standard, not reasonableness
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness vs. palpable and overriding error
Procedural_Issue: Incorrect standard of review applied by RAD
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on claimed risk upon return
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim denied at RPD and RAD levels
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RAD failed to exercise independent appellate function
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicants' testimony and documentary evidence supporting refugee claim
Legal_Framework: IRPA, administrative law principles on standards of review
Applicant_Challenge: RAD erred by deferring to RPD instead of independently reviewing legal and factual errors
Court_Result: RAD decision overturned, matter remanded to new RAD panel

Remedy_Sought: Allowance of judicial review and referral back to RAD
Governing_Rule: Palpable and overriding error standard in appellate review by RAD
